reference.shortdesc:
The dita element is the root element for the ditabase document type.
This topic should be removed from the base spec and added to the tech comm spec. It should include info about use cases (and maybe when to use ditabase, and when to NOT use ditabase.)

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The dita element can contain any sequence of topics, and the ditabase document type enables these topic types to nest.
The dita element cannot be specialized.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: xmlns:ditaarch and DITAArchVersion from , and .

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows a ditabase document that contains multiple topics:
example.codeblock: <dita> <concept id="batintro"> <title>Intro to bats</title> <conbody> <!-- ... --> </conbody> </concept> <task id="batfeeding"> <title>Feeding a bat</title> <taskbody> <!-- ... --> </taskbody> </task> <reference id="batparts"> <title>Parts of bats</title> <refbody> <!-- ... --> </refbody> </reference> <!-- ... --> </dita>
